articles.content: Doctors treating COVID-19 now say that purple or blue toe lesions appearing on patients toes may be a way to diagnose infection, as these have  appeared in otherwise asymptomatic and severe cases alike; however, so far there have been no conclusive studies to… [+2309 chars]

articles.title: Testing begins for people who don't have COVID-19 symptoms - WPLG Local 10
articles.description: Testing asymptomatic people in South Florida is a big step in figuring out how many people are actually carrying the coronavirus, doctors say.

articles.author: Jacqueline Howard, CNN
articles.title: Covid-19 fears keep people from hospitals, but doctors say call 911 for heart attack and stroke - CNN
articles.description: Fears of Covid-19 are keeping people away from hospitals. But some truly ill people need to be calling 911, doctors say in a new report.
articles.content:
(CNN)As the world continues to fight the coronavirus pandemic, a message from health officials has been consistent and clear: stay home.

articles.title: A coronavirus patient thought he was recovering. Then doctors found blood clots in his lungs — a new and poten - Business Insider India
articles.description: Doctors are finding blood clots in the lungs, heart, and kidneys of coronavirus patients, some of whom are critically ill and others who seem relatively stable.
articles.content:

articles.title: A large percent of COVID-19 patients are asymptomatic: Why this is concerning - The News Minute
articles.description: It has been 83 days since India reported its first COVID-19 case in Kerala, on January 30.
articles.content: According to the Union Health Ministry, 80% of the COVID-19 patients are either asymptomatic or exhibit mild symptoms.It has been 83 days since India reported its first COVID-19 case in Kerala, on January 30. A lot has happened since the number of cases cross… [+9799 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: A herd immunity strategy could actually work in youthful India - Livemint
articles.description: By allowing the virus to be unleashed in a controlled way for the next seven months would give 60% of the country’s people immunity by November, and thus halt the disease

articles.title: The Coronavirus May Be Doing Something Strange to Your Toes - Futurism
articles.description: "We don’t know for sure if it’s related to COVID-19."
articles.content:
Health practitioners are noticing a strange new sign that patients could be carrying the coronavirus without symptoms such as a dry cough or fever.
